intro: Machaerina boninsimae, commonly known as the Bonin machaerina, is a rare flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant is adapted to the humid, subtropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and threats from habitat loss, it is considered endangered. Its unique botanical features make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
